Thousands of programs that nobody has heard of can be cracked easily because their protection is generally very weak.  Thus many new would be crackers can do so.  However, on larger application the level of difficulty goes up, and requires a more skilled cracker.

Yes, it can be cracked.  However, a larger group (or talented individual) will be the one(s) to do so.

      anonymous at 2007-06-13 08:42:48
      Use this number for the serial number: 5275-5191-5785-832 ..and below that you'll see the product ID number input. Use this number for the Product ID: 771-836 Let the program continue to install itself. When it's finished, start the program for the first time. Phase Three - Registration Now, this is VERY IMPORTANT. You CAN NOT use the internet to register your product. I'm sure this serial number is blacklisted. So...open a new set of books, or a test set of books, or a set of books (Quickbook file) of a company you have already setup from a previous version of Quickbooks. A Window will open asking you to register your product. DO NOT CLICK ON THE BUTTON TO REGISTER. Instead, if you look in the middle of this window, there will be what looks like a standard underlined web link titled "use telephone to register" or something similar to that. Click on that, and another window will open. Use this number for the telephone registration number: 25549 ...and that should do it. You should now have a working copy of Quickbooks on your computer. The telephone registration number is for people that are trying to register their product without internet access (if that is even possible today), so when they call Intuit, a representative gives them a number to activate the program...and that's how we get by the internet registration snafu. I would highly suggest you DO NOT try and connect Quickbooks to the internet at any time, not even for product upgrades. You might wind up with a disabled Quickbooks on your PC. If you accidentally close the registration window during the registration process, you can always try again by pulling down the help menu and clicking on registration. Enjoy

At least do any of you have an alternate recommended Point of Sale software that includes serial tracking and customizable receipts?

This is the message intuit sent me:

Dear XXXXX XXXX,

Thank you for contacting Intuit.

Thank you for your recent request for a new QuickBooks license number.

It is Intuit's policy to require proof of purchase before providing new or replacement license numbers for QuickBooks software.

Our understanding is that you purchased the product: QUICKBOOKS POINT OF SALE V6.0 new from retail and that the license number is missing. We are sorry for this inconvenience. Please fax a copy of the back of the CD holder where the License Number sticker should appear, a copy of the CD, a copy of the box bottom, and a copy of the store sales receipt or packing slip to:Please fax this information to: 520-844-6451
Please note your reference number on the fax.

Upon receipt of your fax, QuickBooks Registration Issue Resolution will reply by either phone, fax, or e-mail with the information you need to install your product.

Guys, i found a solution (its more like a trick) Go to C:\ProgramData\Intuit\Entitlement Client\v3 (Vista users) and delete EntitlementDataStore.ecml (or turn it into EntitlementDataStore.bak if you are scared to delete it. The timer will go again to 30 days and the program will create a new entitlementdatastore.ecml.Delete it once a while and you ll be ok.There is no problem if you do it after the program reaches 0 days.For xp users, go to C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Application Data\Intuit\Entitlement Client\v3\ and follow the same procedure.Good luck (it worked to me!)
